subject: Design
title: Tiny Houses: The Anti-McMansion
description: A short lesson to help you apply Tiny Houses: The Anti-McMansion.

hook.text: A growing movement says: 400 square feet is enough. Tiny houses challenge everything about modern living.

buildup.text: Tiny houses force radical design choices: loft beds, fold-down tables, and stairs that double as storage.

discovery.text: The movement isn't just about space â€” it's a philosophy against consumerism and mortgage debt.

twist.text: Most tiny house owners quit within 5 years. The romance of small living fades in winter.

climax.text: Tiny houses pushed big ideas: modular construction, multi-use furniture, and intentional living.

punchline.text: The tiniest homes inspired the biggest design rethink.
